quite.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The food in the cafeteria is usually quite good.
His hair is quite thin on top now.
Amy’s at college, and she’s doing quite well.
He’s quite a good soccer player.
quite.translation[0].definitions[0].note: You say quite a before an adjective and a noun
It took quite a long time to answer the questions
It took a quite long time
quite.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: fairly, or to a small extent, but not very
quite.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The film was quite good, but the book was much better.
I got a letter from Sylvia quite recently.
quite.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: What she’s suggesting is quite ridiculous!
I think you’ve had quite enough to drink already!
